body_html:
Nope, you get AttributeError: module 'torch' has no attribute 'version'

Seems Conda is confused that pytorch and pytorch-nightly have different names, but they are both pytorch. The solution is to use --force flag when trying to change from pytorch to pytorch-nightly and vica versa

conda install -c pytorch pytorch -y --force
conda install -c pytorch pytorch-nightly -y --force

Seems Conda is  confused that pytorch and pytorch-nightly have different names, but they are both pytorch. The solution is to use --force flag when trying to change from pytorch to pytorch-nightly and vica versa
conda install -c pytorch pytorch -y --force
conda install -c pytorch pytorch-nightly -y --force
body:
Nope, you get `AttributeError: module 'torch' has no attribute 'version'`

Seems Conda is  confused that pytorch and pytorch-nightly have different names, but they are both pytorch. The solution is to use --force flag when trying to change from pytorch to pytorch-nightly and vica versa

conda install -c pytorch pytorch -y --force
conda install -c pytorch pytorch-nightly -y --force
